metadata.Title: CVE-2023-46753 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in FRRouting FRR through 9.0.1. A crash can occur for a crafted BGP UPDATE message without mandatory attributes, e.g., one with only an unknown transit attribute.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-46753` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.1-1ubuntu1.7
frr-pythontools - 8.1-1ubuntu1.7
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.1-1ubuntu1.7
frr-snmp - 8.1-1ubuntu1.7
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> the quagga project was renamed to frr

criterions.comment: frr package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1-1ubuntu1.7').
